p.s: The drama extract of the tragedy Macbeth by William Shakespeare is part of act 1 scene 7 and deals with the topic that Macbeth's conscience has warned him not to go ahead with the plan to kill the present king Duncan while he gets interrupted by his wife, Lady Macbeth.
For Macbeth it is not important to become kingKing of Cawdor because he does not destroy his high reputation from all sorts of people by killing Duncan.
But his wife pushspushes him not give up the plan that they made.
Because when he would become kingKing of Cawdor his high reputation gets higher than before.
Lady Macbeth tells him also that he should not give up the thing that he wants because then Macbeth sees himself later on as a coward.
His wife is also convinces him that the time and place is perfect at this point and that Macbeth has yet the motivation and energy to act.
Macbeth has still feat but Lady Macbeth tells him that he has to be more braver and after that she tells her husband about the plan she makes.
Macbeth's condition is that his wife should bring four men-children and only when this comes true he will kill Duncan.
To sum up, you can see that the wish of Cawdor is not anymore as relevant as before for Macbeth.
Also you can see that the thoughts of Macbeth are very various because of the fact that he is contented with his reputation he does not want to kill Duncan anymore.
